Various data sources were gathered to create a holistic, detailed study of the pharmaceutical industry.

All references and links to the following data on the web is located in the References tab.

#### Out-of-Pocket Prescription Drug Costs

This data was pulled from the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services' National Health Expenditure Accounts, which track a wide variety of types health spending in the United States.

The link to this data source can be found [here](https://www.cms.gov/Research-Statistics-Data-and-Systems/Statistics-Trends-and-Reports/NationalHealthExpendData/NationalHealthAccountsProjected).

![](dollar_pill.png)

#### U.S. Pharmaceutical Companies Stock ETF

This data was pulled from Yahoo Finance's stock price record of the iShares U.S. Pharmaceuticals ETF, or IHE. This ETF tracks overall market performance and changes for the largest Pharmaceutical companies in the United States.

The link to this data source can be found [here](https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/IHE?p=IHE).

![](pharma.png)

#### U.S. Weekly Influenza Deaths

This data was pulled from the CDC's Weekly Influenza Surveillance Report which tracks weekly influenza, pneumonia, and COVID-19 deaths in the United States. In this project, I focused on the weekly influenza data, which will be explained further in future tabs.

The link to this data source can be found [here](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/weekly/index.htm#FluSurvNet).

![](tamiflu.png)
